paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on TTR variants, including clinical significance, penetrance data, and individual records.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P1 was diagnosed with early-onset Alzheimer's disease at age 54.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Alzheimer's disease with significant cognitive decline
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P2 exhibited significant cognitive decline and was diagnosed at age 61.
Patient P3 remains asymptomatic despite carrying the variant.
Patient P4 was diagnosed with late-onset Alzheimer's disease at age 69.

functional_data.summary: The TTR variant p.Leu87Pro was shown to affect the protein's ability to bind Aβ oligomers.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in families.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on functional assays and family segregation.
variants.additional_notes: The variant was engineered for stability in the study.
key_quotes: The interaction of TTR with Aβ has been confirmed by many other studies in vitro.
Patient P1 was diagnosed with early-onset Alzheimer's disease at age 54.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
